Polling evidence from the April McClatch: Marist poll that found 25 percent of Sanders supporters would not back Clinton as the Democratic nominee.
Comparison made by Clinton during an Apr: 2016, town hall with ABC’s Good Morning America, referencing the 2008 primary bid against Barack Obama and stating that 40 percent of her supporters at that time said they wouldn't support Obama.
Examination of two polls from June 2008: with roughly 60 percent backing Obama and 40 percent not supporting him through either a vote for Republican nominee John McCain or other actions.
